description: From Middle English despisen, from Old French despis-, stem of despire, from Latin dēspicere, present active infinitive of dēspiciō (“I look down upon, despise, scorn”), from dē (“down”) + speciō (“I look at”). Displaced native Old English forsēon.

verbs.description: despise (third-person singular simple present despises, present participle despising, simple past and past participle despised)

entries.meaning: To regard with contempt or scorn.
examples: James still despises his brother for the time he pushed him out of a tree during their childhood.
